title: 🗓️ Week 5Multidimensional poverty
text:
What is EVA?
EVA is a dataset of cultivated areas per municipality. It contains the extent of different crops as well as their productivity per year. It is collected by the Unidad de Planificación Rural Agropecuaria (UPRA)

title: 🗓️ Week 5Multidimensional poverty
text:

Click on the “Agricola” tab:

text:
Resultados 2023

Read the Resultados 2023 document and write down one-page summary comparing your department with the country.

title: 🗓️ Week 5Multidimensional poverty
text:
Agricultural Database 2023

Download the Base agrícola 2019 - 2023.xlsx file
Read the file in Excel
Edit the file and save it as a csv file

title: 🗓️ Week 5Multidimensional poverty
text:
Monetary poverty
Poverty is about not having enough money to meet basic needs including food, clothing and shelter. However, poverty is more, much more than just not having enough money (Economic and social inclusion Corporation).

title: 🗓️ Week 5Multidimensional poverty
text:
Multidimensional poverty
Poverty is hunger. Poverty is lack of shelter. Poverty is being sick and not being able to see a doctor. Poverty is not having access to school and not knowing how to read. Poverty is not having a job, is fear for the future, living one day at a time (WB).

Part 1






Important

Part 2






Important

What is the datum MAGNA-SIRGAS?
Describe the Colombian map projection (EPSG:9377)

title: 🗓️ Week 02 - Geospatial data and geographical information
text:
In this week, we will cover the following topics:
Theoretical topics:
What are the most important characteristics of geographic data?
How are geographic data transformed into information?
What conceptual models are used to represent geographic objects and phenomena
What are the most commonly used data structures and formats?
Practical exercises:
Make a topographic map of your department
Review of geographic metadata

title: 2015896 - GEOMATICA BASICA
text:
DESCRIPCIÓN DE LA ASIGNATURA:








Entender y aplicar conceptos, métodos y técnicas geoespaciales.
Desarrollar destrezas prácticas para realizar procesos digitales útiles en las ciencias agronómicas.
Brindar oportunidades para desarrollar pensamiento crítico, razonamiento espacial y calidad argumentativa.





Capacidad para usar las herramientas tecnológicas, de la información y de la comunicación
Capacidad para organización y planificación
Capacidad de comunicación





Capacidad de abstracción, análisis y síntesis.
Capacidad de integrar y aplicar los conocimientos en la práctica.
Capacidad de lectura en inglés.
Capacidad para organizar y planificar el tiempo.
Capacidad para desarrollar pensamiento crítico, razonamiento espacial y calidad argumentativa





Lectura antes de la clase a cargo del estudiante
Presentación de conceptos, métodos y técnicas a cargo del profesor
Realización de lecturas, ejercicios prácticos y elaboración de informes a cargo del estudiante





QGIS
R & RStudio

title: 2015896 - GEOMATICA BASICA
text:
CONTENIDO DETALLADO






Important





Semana 1 – Introducción, contexto y conceptos básicos
Semana 2 – Datos geoespaciales e información geográfica
Semana 3 - Sistemas de coordenadas y proyecciones cartográticas
Semana 4 - Conceptos básicos de cartografía
Semana 5 - Modelos digitales de elevación
Semana 6 – Sistemas de información geográfica
Semana 7 – Servicios web geográficos
Semana 8 – Sistemas satelitales de navegación global
Semana 9 – Calidad de datos geográficos
Semana 10 – Principios físicos de percepción remota
Semana 11 – Percepción remota de la vegetación
Semana 12 - Métodos determinísticos de interpolación espacial
Semanas 14 y 15 - Métodos geoestadísticos de interpolación espacial
Semana 16 - Agricultura digital

title: 2015896 - GEOMATICA BASICA
text:
EVALUACIÓN DEL CURSO:






Important






Presentación de dos exámenes teóricos (50%)

Examen 1 - 24 de Septiembre
Examen 2 - 26 de Noviembre

Entrega de dos informes técnicos (50%)

Informe 1 - 1 de Octubre
Informe 2 - 3 de Diciembre

title: 2015896 - GEOMATICA BASICA
text:
BIBLIOGRAFIA






Important





Brunsdon, C. and Comber, L. An introduction to R for spatial analysis and mapping [2nd ed.], SAGE, 2019.
Duncombe, R. Digital technologies for Agricultural and Rural Development in the Global South. CABI, 2018.
Gomarasca, M. Basics of Geomatics. Springer, 2009.
Longley, P.A., Goodchild M.F., Maguire, D.J. and Rhind, D.W. Geographic Information Systems [4th edition], Wiley, 2015.
Lovelace, R., Nowosad, J., and Muenchow, J. Geocomputation with R [2nd ed.],CRC Press, 2023. Available at https://geocompr.robinlovelace.net/
Pebesma, E. & Bivand, R. Spatial data science with applications in R. CRC Press, 2023.
Plant, R.E. Spatial Data Analysis in Ecology and Agriculture Using R [2nd ed.], CRC Press, 2019.
Wegman, M., Leutner, B., and Dech, S. Remote Sensing and GIS for Ecologists: using Open Source Software, Pelagic Publishing, 2016.

title: 2015896 - GEOMATICA BASICA
text:
📑 Course Brief
Focus: the focus of this course is introduce concepts, methods and tecniques used in geoinformation disciplines.
How: reading, learning by doing and writing


🎯 Learning Objectives

Understand the usefulness of geospatial data for supporting agronomy.
Internalize basic concepts about geodesy, cartography, GIS, remote sensing, and geostatistics.
Be able to apply geospatial techniques for data collection, processing, visualization and analysis.
Develop critical spatial thinking.


Select Academic Year/Term:
 2025

title: 2015896 - GEOMATICA BASICA
text:
